text: Sindhutai Sapkal (14 November 1948 â€“ 4 January 2022) was an Indian social worker and social activist. She was known for her work in raising orphaned children in India. She was awarded the Padma Shri in 2021. She took care of over 1,500 orphaned children. She had a grand family of 382 sons-in-law and 49 daughters-in-law. She used award money to buy land to make a home for orphaned children. Sapkal died of a heart attack in Pune, India on 4 January 2022, at the age of 73. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Indian activists Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Marathi people
